page.title: 12ROMAN BATH-HOUSE
page.content: Welwyn, Hertfordshire, is a very old town. There is much evidence of Roman occupation, particularly within the former area of Lockleys Park known as Dicket Mead which adjoins the River Mimram, but which has now been altered to allow for road improvements. One of the most remarkable discoveries was made by local archaeologist, Mr Tony Rook of Welwyn, under whose direction a complete Roman Bathhouse has been excavated and preserved. It actually lies beneath the A1 motorway in a especially designed building which is now administered by the Welwyn Hatfield Museum Service and is normally open to the public on Sundays between 2 - 5 pm. It is thought to have formed part of a Roman villa or complex of buildings.
